definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Russia, a major oil producer, is unlikely to embrace any ambitious emissions reductions.
sentences.chinese: 產油大國俄羅斯不太可能歡迎任何大幅減排計劃。

sentences.english: On the whole, average weekly hours are far below their pre-recession level.
sentences.chinese: 整體而言，周平均工作時間比起衰退前大幅下滑。

sentences.english: After soil improvement, the yield of this land has increased greatly.
sentences.chinese: 改土後，這塊地的產量大幅提升。

sentences.english: Your chances of being dissected just declined dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 你被解剖的概率已經大幅度下降。

sentences.english: Like any gemstone, take care not to subject your amethyst jewellery to sharp blows.

sentences.english: Even so, other reports showed big drops in housing sales in May. That followed the end of a homebuyer's tax credit.

sentences.english: China's energy policies will also boost demand for uranium.

sentences.english: Hybrid fibers can improve impact strength of concrete near 7 times.
sentences.chinese: 混合纖維可以大幅提高混凝土抗衝擊性能近7倍。

sentences.english: ' Although the cost of shipping goods from Nanjing and other mainland airports has fallen dramatically.
sentences.chinese: 儘管從南京及其它內地機場運輸貨物的費用大幅下降。

sentences.english: It may raise the strength of the coarse grained soil.

sentences.english: Gives high earners big breaks on the payroll tax.

definition: to decline/to drop/to fall/to go down/to decrease
to slow down/to ease up/to abate/slowdown/downturn
to rise again after a fall/to pick up/rally (stock market etc)
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
